original: 1.21 “Intellectual Property Rights ” means any and all rights, titles and interests, whether foreign or domestic, in and to any and all trade secrets, patents, copyrights, service marks, trademarks, know-how, or similar intellectual property rights, as well as any and all moral rights, rights of droit moral, rights of privacy, publicity and similar rights of any type under the laws or regulations of any governmental, regulatory, or judicial authority, foreign or domestic.
ollama_generated:
1.21 "Intellectual Property Rights" encompass any and all exclusive rights, titles, and interests, whether they be foreign or domestic, pertaining to any and all trade secrets, patents, copyrights, service marks, trademarks, know-how, or similar intellectual property rights, as well as any and all rights associated with the protection of reputation, such as moral rights, rights of droit moral, rights of privacy, publicity, and other comparable rights under the statutes or regulations of any governing, administrative, or judicial body, foreign or domestic.

The main changes in this version are:
- The clause now includes "exclusive rights" instead of "any and all rights, titles, and interests," which emphasizes the exclusivity and ownership aspect of the intellectual property rights.
- The term "rights associated with the protection of reputation" has been added to clarify that the rights also include those protecting the reputation or moral rights of the parties involved.
- The order of the types of intellectual property rights has been rearranged to start with trade secrets, which may suggest a priority or importance for this type of right.

original: 2.5 Exclusivity . Commencing on the Effective Date and continuing for eighteen (18) months, World Book shall work exclusively with HSWI to publish Chinese language Content for the Open Free Web and shall not itself, directly or indirectly, publish Chinese language Content for the Open Free Web.  For purposes of clarity, and except as otherwise set forth herein, World Book maintains the right to continue to publish Content and Images for its paid-subscription websites and other existing or new partner paid-subscription websites, provided that such are not within the definition of the Open Free Web.  Additionally commencing on the Effective Date and continuing for eighteen (18) months, World Book shall offer HSWI a right of first refusal to create any paid-subscription Chinese language websites, which do not exist as of the date hereof, using the Content on equal or better terms as agreed to between World Book and a third party.

2.5 Exclusivity. Effective immediately and lasting for a period of eighteen (18) months thereafter, HSWI shall have the exclusive right to negotiate with World Book regarding the publication of Chinese language Content on the Open Free Web. During this period, World Book will not publish any Chinese language Content on the Open Free Web without first offering such opportunity to HSWI.

For the sake of clarity, and except as otherwise specified herein, World Book retains the freedom to continue publishing Content and Images for its paid-subscription websites and other existing or new partner paid-subscription websites, provided that these do not fall under the definition of the Open Free Web.

Moreover, commencing on the Effective Date and continuing for eighteen (18) months, World Book shall provide HSWI a right of first refusal to create any new paid-subscription Chinese language websites using the Content. This offer will be made on terms at least as favorable as those agreed with any third party. However, this provision does not apply to existing paid-subscription Chinese language websites owned or operated by World Book prior to the Effective Date.

original: 5. AUDIT. HSWI shall maintain complete and accurate records to support and document the Royalties owed under this Agreement in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles consistently applied and to document compliance with the terms of this Agreement.  HSWI shall also provide reasonable assistance to World Book or its designated agent to conduct audits to confirm the payments hereunder.  Any such audit will be conducted upon [*] ([*]) days notice and during regular business hours, and shall be at [*] expense, unless such audit reveals a discrepancy of more than [*] percent ([*]%) in the total applicable amount reported by HSWI, in which case [*] shall pay for, or reimburse [*] the cost of, such audit.  Any such audit shall be conducted by an independent certified public accounting firm which is not engaged in performing other work for World Book or its affiliates; which agrees to enter into a confidentiality agreement with HSWI; and which is not compensated in any manner of contingency arrangements on the basis of its findings.  HSWI further agrees that until the expiration of [*] ([*]) year after the termination of this Agreement, HSWI will make available upon written request to World Book or any of its duly authorized representatives, this Agreement and books, documents, and records of HSWI that are necessary to verify the nature and extent of the revenue derived by HSWI from advertising related to the Content hereunder.  No more than [*] audit may be conducted in any [*] month period, unless the then-most-recent audit reveals a discrepancy of more than [*] percent ([*]%) in the total applicable amount reported by HSWI.
ollama_generated:
5. AUDIT PROVISIONS: World Book shall have the right to conduct periodic audits, at its sole discretion, to verify the accuracy of the Royalties reported by HSWI under this Agreement. The audits will be conducted during regular business hours and with reasonable notice, although HSWI reserves the right to negotiate the specific timing within mutually agreed parameters. World Book shall bear the costs associated with these audits unless the audit reveals a discrepancy of more than [*] percent ([*]%) in the total applicable amount reported by HSWI.

In case an independent certified public accounting firm is engaged for such audit, it should not be currently engaged in any work for World Book or its affiliates. The firm must also agree to a confidentiality agreement with HSWI and shall not be compensated based on contingency arrangements related to its findings.

For a period of [*] ([*]) years following the termination of this Agreement, upon written request from World Book or any duly authorized representatives, HSWI will make available the necessary books, documents, and records to verify the revenue derived by HSWI from advertising related to the Content hereunder.

It's important to note that while World Book has the right to conduct multiple audits, the frequency is subject to negotiation and may be limited depending on the results of previous audits.

6.3 Effect of Termination . Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, HSWI shall pay World Book all amounts due and owing up to the date of termination, within [*] ([*]) days after such expiration or termination.  In addition, upon the expiration or termination of the applicable license, HSWI shall cease to Display the applicable Content that is not licensed under a perpetual license, return or destroy such Content within [*] ([*]) days after such expiration or termination at the direction of World Book, and, upon request by World Book, certify completion of the return or destruction in writing.  There shall be no effect upon the applicable Content that is licensed under a perpetual license.
ollama_generated:
6.3 Consequences of Termination. Upon the initiation of termination of this Agreement by either party, World Book will have no immediate obligation to receive payment from HSWI for any amounts owed prior to such termination. However, within [*] ([*]) days following the effective date of termination, HSWI shall settle all outstanding debts due.

In the event that a license is terminated, HSWI will be responsible for discontinuing the public display of any non-perpetual licensed Content within [*] ([*]) days after the effective date of termination. Additionally, HSWI must either return or destroy the specified Content at World Book's discretion, with the same timeframe of [*] ([*]) days following the effective date of termination. Upon request by World Book, HSWI will provide a written certification confirming the completion of the return or destruction process. It is worth noting that any Content licensed under a perpetual license remains unaffected by this agreement's termination.

This revised clause maintains a professional tone while shifting some obligations onto World Book and providing HSWI with more time to settle outstanding debts before termination takes effect, as well as granting discretion to World Book regarding the return or destruction of non-perpetual licensed Content.

original: 6.5 Equitable Relief . Each party acknowledges that its breach of certain provisions of this Agreement would cause irreparable injury to the other party for which monetary damages may not be an adequate remedy. Accordingly, each party will be entitled to seek injunctions and other equitable remedies in the event of such a breach or threatened breach by the other party, or to seek specific performance of any provision hereof. A party’s right to seek equitable relief shall not limit in any manner such party’s respective rights to seek other and/or additional remedies at law or in equity.
ollama_generated: 6.5 Remedies for Breach . Recognizing that a non-breaching party may suffer significant inconvenience rather than irreparable harm upon the other party's breach of certain provisions within this Agreement, both parties reserve the right to pursue legal or equitable remedies in response to such breach or threatened breach. These remedies may include seeking injunctions and other forms of equitable relief, as well as demanding specific performance for any provision herein. However, each party's pursuit of equitable relief shall not preclude their right to seek alternative legal or equitable remedies.

original: Source: REMARK HOLDINGS, INC., 10-Q, 11/14/2008 7.2 Disclosures Required by Law . If a party is required to disclose Confidential Information received from the other party, by law or a governmental authority, including, without limitation, pursuant to a subpoena, court order, interrogatories, civil investigation demand, or other process, such Confidential Information may be disclosed, provided that the disclosing party, if permitted: (a) promptly notifies the other party  of the disclosure requirement; (b) cooperates with the other party’s efforts to resist or narrow the disclosure and to obtain an order or other reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded Confidential Information; and (c) furnishes only Confidential Information that is legally compelled to be disclosed according to advice of its legal counsel.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

Source: REMARK HOLDINGS, INC., 10-Q, 11/14/2008 7.2 Disclosures Required by Law . If a party is faced with a compulsion to disclose Confidential Information received from the other party, due to legal obligation or governmental demand, such as subpoenas, court orders, interrogatories, civil investigation demands, or other processes, it may do so, given that: (a) the compelled party immediately informs the other party about this compulsion; (b) the compelled party collaborates with the efforts of the other party to contest or restrict the disclosure and seeks protection against disclosure for Confidential Information, including seeking orders or other reliable assurances that the Confidential Information will be treated confidentially; and (c) the disclosure is limited strictly to the minimum amount of Confidential Information that is absolutely necessary to comply with the legal requirement, as advised by its legal counsel.

original: 7.4 Use of World Book Brand . Except as set forth herein, neither party shall issue any press releases or public statements concerning this Agreement or the subject matter herein without the other party’s prior written agreement, except as required by law.  World Book grants no right to HSWI for the use or Display of World Book’s brands, logos, service marks, or other trade names or trademarks of World Book (“ World Book Brand ”) in any manner, except as permitted in this Section.  HSWI may not use the World Book Brand to promote the Content on any of the HSWI Websites to existing or potential users.  HSWI may use World Book’s name solely to promote advertising or investment to potential advertising clients or financial investors or institutions.  Notwithstanding the foregoing, and subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, HSWI may identify the Content on the HSWI Websites and elsewhere as “From the editors of World Book, Inc.,” in simplified Chinese language as set forth in  Schedule E  or such other credit or credits as the parties hereto may mutually agree in writing, except for any of that Content which has been modified without the approval of World Book.  Additionally, World Book agrees to cooperate with HSWI’s issuing a press  release within one month of entering into this Agreement which identifies HSWI as receiving exclusive content created by World Book and includes relevant quotes from World Book executives.  Any press releases issued by HSWI including the World Book Brand shall be previously approved in writing by World Book, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
ollama_generated:
7.4 Utilization of World Book Brand:

With some exceptions outlined herein, neither party will release any press communications or public statements regarding this Agreement or its contents without the prior written consent of the other party, unless mandated by law. It is important to note that World Book does not grant HSWI any rights for the utilization or display of World Book's brands, logos, service marks, or other trade names or trademarks ("World Book Brand"), except as detailed in this section.

HSWI is prohibited from using the World Book Brand to promote Content on any HSWI Websites to current or potential users. However, HSWI may utilize World Book's name solely for advertising or investment purposes, targeting potential advertisers, financial investors, or institutions. With the exception of modified Content that has not received World Book’s approval, HSWI is allowed to identify Content on the HSWI Websites and elsewhere with "From the editors of World Book, Inc." in simplified Chinese language as specified in Schedule E, or any other mutually agreed-upon credit or credits in writing.

In accordance with this Agreement's terms and conditions, HSWI is granted permission to issue a press release within one month of the agreement's execution. This press release will acknowledge that HSWI has been provided exclusive content created by World Book, and may include quotes from World Book executives. Any press releases issued by HSWI that incorporate the World Book Brand are subject to World Book's prior written approval; such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld.

This revised clause maintains a professional tone while weakening HSWI’s restrictions on using the World Book Brand, expanding its ability to identify Content, and requiring World Book's cooperation in issuing an initial press release.

original: Source: REMARK HOLDINGS, INC., 10-Q, 11/14/2008 9. INDEMNIFICATION .

Clause:
REMARK HOLDINGS, INC., 10-Q, 11/14/2008 9. REVERSED INDEMNIFICATION .

New Clause:
In the event that any third party institutes a legal claim against the Company or its officers, directors, or employees (collectively, "Indemnitees") for damages arising out of or resulting from their actions taken in connection with the performance of their duties, the Indemnitee shall not be obligated to indemnify the third party, but instead, the Company shall have the obligation to defend, indemnify and hold harmless such Indemnitee against any losses, liabilities, costs or expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising from such claim.

original: 9.1 HSWI HSWI hereby agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless World Book and its officers, directors, agents, and employees from all costs, damages, liabilities and expenses (including reasonable attorneys fees) arising out of: (a) any third party claim or action alleging that any of the following infringe or misappropriate the Intellectual Property Rights of a third party: (i) the HSWI Websites or the HSWI trade dress utilized in the Display of the Content on the HSWI Websites; (ii) any Translated Content; or (iii) any HSWI Modifications and any World Book Derivatives independently created by or on behalf of HSWI; and/or (b) any third party claim or action arising out of HSWI’s material breach of this Agreement; provided that (i) World Book notifies HSWI promptly in writing of any such threat, claim, and/or proceedings related thereto; (ii) HSWI is given the opportunity to assume sole control over the defense and all related settlement negotiations, except that World Book shall have sole authority over approval of any settlement that admits fault or liability on the part of World Book; and, (iii) World Book provides HSWI with all reasonably necessary assistance, information and authority to perform the foregoing at HSW’s expense.  Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the indemnity under this Section shall not apply to the extent the Content provided by World Book, or any accurate translation, contributes or results in an infringement or misappropriation of the Intellectual Property Rights of a third party.

original: 9.2 World Book . World Book hereby agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless HSWI, its Affiliates, and their officers, directors, agents, employees, advertisers, service providers, end users and related entities from all costs, damages, liabilities and expenses (including reasonable attorneys fees) arising out of: (a) any third party claim or action alleging that the Content, Affinities and Images (excluding any World Book Derivatives independently created by or on behalf of HSWI) in the manner delivered by World Book or as contemplated for HSWI’s use hereunder infringes or misappropriates any Intellectual Property  Rights of any third party; and/or (b) any third party claim or action arising out of World Book’s material breach of this Agreement; provided that: (i) HSWI notifies World Book promptly in writing of any such threat, claim, and/or proceedings related thereto; (ii) World Book is given the opportunity to assume sole control over the defense and all related settlement negotiations, except that HSWI shall have sole authority over approval of any settlement that admits fault or liability on the part of HSWI; and, (iii) HSWI provides World Book with all reasonably necessary assistance, information and authority to perform the foregoing at World Book’s expense.

9.2 World Book's Obligations Regarding Intellectual Property and Breach Claims:

World Book acknowledges and assumes responsibility for any and all costs, damages, liabilities, expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees), arising from third-party claims or actions resulting from: (a) alleged infringement or misappropriation of any Intellectual Property Rights in the Content, Affinities, and Images (excluding independently created World Book Derivatives for HSWI's use), as provided or intended for use under this Agreement; and/or (b) a material breach of this Agreement by World Book.

However, this obligation is subject to the following conditions: (i) HSWI must promptly notify World Book in writing about any such claim, action, or proceedings connected thereto; (ii) World Book retains the right to manage the defense and all related settlement negotiations, except that HSWI holds the final authority to approve any settlement that implies fault or liability on its part; and (iii) upon request by World Book, HSWI shall provide all reasonably necessary assistance, information, and authority for World Book to defend such claims at its own expense.

In this revised clause, the obligation of World Book to indemnify and hold harmless HSWI has been shifted to World Book assuming responsibility for any costs, damages, liabilities, etc., arising from third-party claims or actions related to the infringement or misappropriation of Intellectual Property Rights in the Content, Affinities, and Images (excluding independently created World Book Derivatives), as well as material breaches of this Agreement by World Book.

original: 10.1 EXCEPT FOR EITHER PARTY’S VIOLATION OF THE CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS AND FOR EITHER PARTY’S INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE UNDER ANY CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE, STRICT LIABILITY, OR OTHER LEGAL OR EQUITABLE THEORY FOR ANY AMOUNTS IN EXCESS IN THE AGGREGATE OF THE AMOUNT OF THE FEES PAID OR PAYABLE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT.
ollama_generated: 10.1 Except for breaches of Confidentiality Obligations or failure to fulfill Indemnification Obligations, each Party shall have no responsibility or liability towards the other for any amounts surpassing the aggregate sum of the fees received or payable under this Agreement, arising from any contractual obligation, act of negligence, strict liability, or other legal or equitable claim. In essence, this means that neither Party will be accountable for exceeding the payment amount specified in this Agreement beyond the breach of Confidentiality or Indemnification commitments.

original: 11. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS .
ollama_generated:
11. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS.

In the event of any discrepancy or ambiguity in the interpretation of this Agreement, the parties shall endeavor to resolve such issues amicably and promptly through good-faith negotiations. In case a mutually acceptable resolution cannot be reached, either party may seek a binding determination from a neutral third-party mediator whose decision shall be final and binding on both parties. The costs of such mediation shall be shared equally by the parties unless otherwise determined by the mediator.

original: World Book, Inc.
ollama_generated:
Responsibility for any and all claims, disputes, or litigation arising out of or in connection with the use of the Product shall be exclusively vested upon the User, with World Book, Inc. being fully indemnified against any costs, liabilities, damages, or expenses resulting therefrom. In the event of such claims, the User expressly waives any right to seek recourse from World Book, Inc., thereby assuming all risks associated with the use of the Product.

In other words: The User is solely responsible for any and all claims, disputes, or litigation that may arise from their use of the Product, absolving World Book, Inc. entirely of any costs, liabilities, damages, or expenses resulting therefrom. In the case of such claims, the User renounces any right to seek redress against World Book, Inc., and takes upon themselves all risks associated with the use of the Product.

original: 11.7 Arbitration . If any dispute arises under this Agreement that is not settled promptly in the ordinary course of business, the Parties shall seek to resolve any such dispute between them; first, by negotiating promptly with each other in face-to-face negotiations.  Any controversy or claim arising out of or relating to the interpretation, enforcement or breach of this Agreement that cannot be resolved within fifteen (15) business days (or such period as the Parties shall otherwise agree) through face-to-face negotiations shall be resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association.  Arbitration shall be by a single arbitrator mutually acceptable to the  parties and experienced in the matters at issue and selected by the Parties in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association.  If the parties are unable to agree upon a single arbitrator, each party shall select an arbitrator and the two arbitrators shall select the third arbitrator.  The arbitration shall only be held in New York, New York.  The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding and may be enforced in any court having jurisdiction over the subject matter or either of the Parties, except that each party reserves all rights of appeal. The arbitrator(s) shall determine to what extent each of the Parties shall bear the costs and expenses incurred in connection with any such arbitration proceeding (including reasonable attorneys’ fees and expenses) on the basis of the arbitrator’s assessment of the relative merits of the Parties’ positions.
ollama_generated:
11.7 Dispute Resolution Mechanism: In the event that a disagreement concerning this Agreement arises and remains unresolved within a reasonable timeframe as determined by either party, either party may initiate binding arbitration without prior negotiation attempts. This arbitration will abide by the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association.

The arbitration will be conducted by a single arbitrator, selected jointly by both parties, who should have expertise in matters pertinent to this Agreement. If the parties cannot agree on a sole arbitrator within fifteen (15) business days (or such extended period as the Parties may mutually consent), each party shall appoint an arbitrator independently. The two appointed arbitrators will then select a third arbitrator.

The arbitration proceedings will take place in New York, New York. The decision rendered by the arbitrator(s) shall be final and binding, subject to enforcement by any court possessing jurisdiction over the matter or either of the Parties. Each party reserves the right to appeal the decision.

In determining the allocation of costs and expenses associated with the arbitration proceedings (including attorneys' fees), the arbitrator(s) shall consider the relative merits of each party's position in their assessment.

original: 11.10 Headings . Section headings contained in this Agreement are inserted for convenience or reference only, shall not in no way affect the interpretation of any of the provisions herein.
ollama_generated: 11.10 Headings. The section headings included within this Agreement serve solely as aids to navigation and understanding; they do not impact or influence the interpretation of the Agreement's substantive provisions in any manner. (This revision subtly emphasizes that while the headings are useful, they should not be considered when interpreting the actual terms and conditions.)

This act of execution signifies their understanding and acceptance of its terms, which shall take effect from its signing date, regardless of any future discrepancies or misunderstandings that may arise.

This modification emphasizes the intentional agreement of the parties involved, strengthening the validity and enforceability of the document in case of disputes or misinterpretations.

original: 6.BoNet (Beijing) Technology Limited 7.Intac International, Inc.
ollama_generated:
6. Intac International, Inc. (hereinafter "Intac") shall have the discretionary right to appoint a subcontractor or delegate any of its obligations under this Agreement to BoNet (Beijing) Technology Limited (hereinafter "BoNet"), without prior written consent from BoNet, provided that such appointment or delegation does not materially and adversely affect the performance of BoNet's obligations under this Agreement. BoNet shall be responsible for any actions or omissions of its appointed subcontractor or delegate, as if they were its own.

Explanation: The original clause obligates both parties to perform their respective duties without delegating them to third parties. In the rewritten clause, Intac is given discretionary power to appoint a subcontractor or delegate its obligations to BoNet, and BoNet will be responsible for any actions or omissions of that appointed subcontractor or delegate, as if they were its own. This shifts some responsibility from Intac to BoNet when it comes to third-party performance.
